publicationStmt.p: This document forms part of the project "Editing the Earth M.M. White Collection" at the University of North Florida.

msIdentifier.repository: University of North Florida, Thomas G. Carpenter Library Special Collections and Archives

msContents.summary: The documents contain information on the members and activities of the Jacksonville Patriot League supporting the United States during World War I.

objectDesc.p: Four typed pages of information of the Jacksonville Patriot Legue accompanied by a page with handwritten arithmetic.

editorialDecl.p: This file was transcribed and encoded according to the editorial criteria of the project "Editing the Eartha M.M. White Collection." Using the various options encoded within <choice> elements, this file enables the viewing of a diplomatic transcription and a regularized reading text.

div.p:
Now that Warwar times are over the Patriotic Leagues that were organized
in all the schoo;sschools last year by Miss White are requested to do community
work.Allwork. All who have been visited so far expressed their willingness
to coopratecooperate in doing all they can for this much needed work.

The La.VillaLa Villa Schoo;School Community League
Professor James Wilson Principal ., MissEdnaMiss Edna Richardson President.,
Miss Delphia Willaims ViceVice President., Miss Thelma Livingston SectySecretary., Miss Ruth Gee
Asst. Secty.Assistant Secretary, Miss Mary King Treasurer.Professor AvantTreasurer. Professor Avant and Miss White
made addresses that were much enjoyed.

The Stanton High School Patriotic League was visited by Miss White
on Monday. They are to have election for the new yearworkandyear work and isare
planning Aa number of things that will be helpful to the Communitycommunity.
The Star Village School with Mrs. Ida Burton at its head organized
Aa Community League. This school is in a splendid condition with more
than 136 puplilspupils enrolled.Theyenrolled. They are goingtogoing to make a speciltyspeciality fofor singing
Thethe Negro Jubilee Songs and when any community desiredesires them to sing
call Mrs. Burton cor.corner of Johnson and Griffin Ave.Avenue. (Private School)

TheyhadThey had a special programmeprogram omon Friday and it would have done your
very soulsgootosouls good to have heard these children recite and sing.

On Wednesday the Davis Street School PaproticPatriotic League held a fine
meetingThismeeting. This school is doing a splendid work and on next Wednesday and
Thursday when special excercises will be there you can see the resultofresult of
their work. Prof.Professor Avant the community worker of the Y.M.C.A.Young Men's Christian Association Andand Miss
White delivered addresses and invited to come again.

The officers are Mr. James Lewis President., Miss M. Jackson ViceVice President.,
Miss Lillie Dawkins SectySecretary? Miss I Williams asstassistant., Mr. Lewis Canty Treasurer.
+and Prof.ProfessorJr. Blueker puine
Several schools are arrangeingarranging to have their picnics on the play Grouplayground.

div.p: theThe Davis St.Street School Patriotic League.

The splendid address of Mrs. Jennings was very much
enjoyed, after which the following persons were elected to
office:

Master Charles Blocker, Pres.President
Miss Bunice Thomas, Vice Pres.President
Miss Annie Richardson, Sec.Secretary
Mrs. Louis Canty, Treas.Treasurer
Prof.Professor Isiah Blocker)
Mrs. Jennings ) Supervisors

p.hi:
Cookman Institute Patriotic League.
Officers Elected.

div.p:
Pres.President Mr. Garret Wiggins.
Vice Pres.President Miss Erolfine Chisholm
Sec.Secretary Mr. William Haynes
Treas.Treasurer Mr. Theodore Owens.

Mrs. Frank Jennings gave a most inspiring talk,
to this school which was greatly enjoyed.

The Jacksonville Patriotic League Committee, who
visited the various schools of this city on Thursday has
succeeded in perfecting an organization at the Stanton High
School. The officers elected were:

p.hi:
Pres.President------Mr. Ralph Bright.
Vice Pres.President-----Miss Rossie French.
Sec.Secretary-------Miss Althea Hayes.
Treas.Treasurer--------Mr. Lemund Bolton.
(Mrs. Edith Gray
Supervisors----(Prof.Professor George Sampson

div.p: The speakers were introduced by Miss Eartha White.

Miss Edith Geay, Secretary of the Jacksonville Red
Cross, gave a spendid address, which was indeed inspiring,
impressing the importance of six important things to be remem
bered. Obedience, Economy, Respect, Prudence, Work, Loyalty.

Mrs. English spoke on the conservation of fuel.
Serg'tSeargent Martin of Camp Johnston, from Boston, Mass.Massachusetts, gave a
short talk which was greatly enjoyed. Other white friends
present were Mrs. Warren Harris
and Miss Genevia Redding.

Prof.Professor Sampson, his teachers and scholares are al
ready doing spendid work. Eighty-two or more have bought
War-Saving Stamps and a boy, Josh Hurst had bought a Liberty
Bond.

Miss Hatch, of the Y.W.C.A.Young Women's Christian Association (white) of this city
gave an excellent address at the Boylan Industrial School.
Miss Lasee, the President, and Mrs. Dr. J. Harvey Smith
who has charge of the girls who are always on the alert to
secure the very best for their girls, as well as the other

teachers and pupils expressed their delight in organizing a
Patriotic League in that school.

Mrs. Frank Jennings and Mrs. Dobbin were delighted
with the Edward Waters College. They were welcomed by Prof.Professor
Gregg, his teachers and Mrs. Eisher, of the City Federation
of Colored Women's Clubs. Owing to holding their week of
prayer a permanent organization will take place on next Tues
day.

Mrs. Bion Barnett and Mrs. Hobart Hare visited the
La Villa school and gave splendid addresses. This organiza
tion has planned to start work at once.Moneyonce. Money was furnished
by these ladies to buy knitting materials. Miss Lloyd, her
teachers and scholars are delighted with this idea.

Mrs. H. W. Dexter and Mr. Dexter visited the Fla.Florida
baptistBaptist College, where exercises were held, and this proved t
to be a great success. The visitors gave addresses, and ex
pressed themselves as being greatly pleased with their visit.

Mrs. Henry Clark and Mrs. W. B. Young gave splendid
addresses. They were recieved very courteously by Prof.Professor
Williams and his teachers.

Davis St.Street Public School was visited by Mrs. Frank
Jennings, accompanied by Miss White. Prof.Professor Isiah Blocker
and his fine set of teachers assembled in their auditorium
where the children rendered a Patriotic Program, oganizing
